dialogue.text: Hey! What are you up to, Sensei?
Come to hang out with one of your six million girlfriends?
All of them at once, actually. And what better place to do that than the dorms?
Hmmm...School, if you can be sneaky enough.
That way, you could even rope some of the other classes into it. You can thank me later for the brilliant idea.
I might just have to do that.
What are {i}you{/i} up to, Uta?
Me? Was just stopping for a quick drink of water on my way out to do some exploring.
Right. You’re still getting acquainted with the area, aren’t you?
Slowly but surely. It’s not as confusing as the area I was living in before this.
Over there, since the[school] was {i}in{/i} the actual city part, we didn’t get those cool stretches of nothingness like you have over here.
Reminds me a lot of Nara but with less wildlife and more...tamed life.
Is that a good or bad thing? I don’t think I’ve really asked you how you feel about this place other than the class itself.
It’s not...bad?
Like yeah the class is awesome and I’m glad to finally have a teacher who doesn’t creep me out-
Wait, what? Your other teachers creeped you out but I somehow don’t?
Oh, totally. They kept trying to steal my stuff when I wasn't looking.
You should report that to the principal.
Probably. You’ve been fun so far, though.
As far as Kumon-mi itself goes, it’s not what I’d call my ideal place to live...but it’s not like I’m dying to get out just yet.
What would your ideal place to live be, then?
Well, even though it can get kind of boring over there at times, I think I {i}do{/i} prefer the country overall.
Places like this kinda lose their luster once you realize you can just do anything you want whenever you want.
It turns stuff I always viewed as super-special outings into another way of life.
But, it’s definitely easier finding work over here. Not a lot of maid cafes where I’m from.
And also not a lot of teachers willing to just let us girls teach ourselves. So, thanks!
Interesting.
I don’t think I’d particularly enjoy living in the country.
But it’s not like Uta and I need to agree on everything in order to become better acquainted.
I understand why she’d want to be somewhere closer to what she’s grown used to over the course of her life.
Thankfully, I have the advantage (Or disadvantage, depending on how you look at it) of not remembering anything about my childhood-
So somewhere like Kumon-mi is perfect for me.
No need to thank me for being bad at my job. I do that willingly.
Hey! Don’t call yourself bad!
I’m tryin’ to be serious here, Sensei. I think you’re great.
Even Io has started feeling at home here and I don’t think she even looks at the bathhouse that way.
Plus, I think it’s cool that you’re allowed to come to the dorms and talk to us.
I feel more inclined to learn if I’m closer to whoever’s teaching me.
Is that code for “Let’s get even closer, Sensei?”
Ohohoh~ It's starting to sound like {i}somebody{/i} wants to hug.
That person is me. But I think it still might be too soon.
I shall pay closer attention to how much I am supposed to dislike you and will ignore the wonderful chemistry we have begun to form with each other.
I am sorry things had to end like this.
I understand, Sensei. Things {i}needed{/i} to happen this way before they became too serious and one of us wound up with a broken heart.
Probably me because I get attached too easily and would never leave you since I’m so nice.
I’ve changed my mind. I love you.
I remember...when I loved you...
It feels so long ago now...
Goodbye...Sensei...
Uta smiles and walks right past me, closing her eyes and sighing to herself as she forever disappears from my life.
The days we shared with one another were brief, but they will echo in the back of my mind for as long as I live.
I will never forget you, Uta Ushibori.
May you find happiness wherever the cold wind takes you.
{i}Uta’s affection has increased to [uta_love]!{/i}
